title_en: The president of the Cambridge Trade Union, who went on a hunger strike, was rushed to the hospital
summary_en:
The president of the EXCLUSIVECambridge trade union has been taken to hospital after a hunger strike in protest against corruption and nepotism at the university.
Pratap began his hunger strike 24 days after protesting against alleged corruption and nepotism in the Cambridge University Student Union.
In the letter, Pratap accused the university and the student union of racially motivated harassment and demanded that a number of requirements be fulfilled.
Pratap's hunger strike has become a test of his own patience, and he intends to continue it until all the requirements are met.
Cambridge SU called a student meeting to discuss Pratap's demands after his petition reached the required signature threshold.
The scandal occurred against the background of a new wave of hunger strikes on the campuses of British and American universities in protest against Israel's war against Hamas in Gaza.

title_en: A Judge Ordered The University Of California Academic Workers Union To Suspend The Strike
summary_en:
A state judge has ordered graduate students at the University of California to temporarily end a strike at six campuses.
The leadership of the University of California has won in a legal effort to force the strikers to return to work.
The strike began in response to the administration's crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests on the Los Angeles and Irvine campuses.
The union accused the university system of authorizing violent arrests and violating workers' right to peaceful protest.
The injunction orders graduate teachers and researchers to temporarily return to work.
The union accused UC of committing various unfair labor actions caused by its protest reaction.
The university system stated that the reasons for the strike were purely political and social in nature.
The graduate students insist that the fight is being waged for their right as employees to protest without fear of arrest or retaliation.
